About me

This site is about me as a programmer and a researcher.

In 2015, I've got a Ph.D. at University of Lille (France) under the supervision of Stéphane Ducasse and Damien Cassou. I was part of RMoD research group at Inria. In my thesis I've worked in software evolution, first-class code changes, code integration activities, and untangling code changes.

Previously, I've studied at the Departamento de Computación, Universidad de Buenos Aires, where I received my degree in Computer Sciences. In my master thesis, I worked in Fuel, an object serialization framework for Pharo, which has been adopted by the community. My supervisors were Hernán Wilkinson, Carlos E. Ferro, and Stéphane Ducasse.

During my master I've programmed many years for consulting and software development companies such as Hexacta.

Research interests

  • Programming languages
  • Reflective Systems
  • Software comprehension, maintenance and evolution
  • Source code analysis and manipulation
  • Mining software repositories
  • Others
